intro: Hieracium praetenerifrons, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a hairy surface, and the flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and other open habitats.
